describe: The Marshall Islands is a sprawling chain of volcanic islands and coral atolls in the central Pacific Ocean, between Hawaii and the Philippines. Known for its rich marine biodiversity, it offers pristine beaches, crystal-clear waters, and a unique cultural heritage.

cities.name: üèù Majuro
cities.geographical_location: Located on the eastern side of the Marshall Islands, Majuro is the capital and largest city.
cities.climate: Tropical rainforest climate with consistent temperatures and high humidity year-round.
cities.famous_cuisine: Barramundi cod, coconut crab, and breadfruit dishes.

cities.name: üèù Ebeye
cities.geographical_location: Situated on the Kwajalein Atoll, Ebeye is one of the most densely populated islands in the Pacific.
cities.climate: Tropical climate with a wet season from May to November.
cities.famous_cuisine: Fresh seafood, pandanus fruit, and taro.
